#Text=Chris Rice
#Text=For the U.S. Virgin
#Text=Islands sport shooter , see Chris Rice ( sport shooter ) .
#Text=For the author , see Christopher Rice .
#Text=Chris
#Text=Rice
#Text=is an American singer and songwriter who works in the contemporary Christian music , contemporary folk and adult contemporary genres .
#Text=He became a recording artist as well in 1996 after signing a contract with Rocketown Records and releasing his debut album , Deep Enough to Dream .
#Text=Biography
#Text=Early years
#Text=Chris Rice , a native of Clinton , Maryland , grew up as the second of four sons born to bookstore owners .
#Text=His parents , and other adult mentors , influenced Rice 's Christian faith and his early work with youth and college students .
#Text=Having taken only three years of piano lessons as a child , Rice did not aspire to a career in either music or student work .

#Text=But frequent invitations to speak and lead music at his church 's youth group events led to more such invitations throughout his college years at the University of Maryland , Grace College in Winona Lake , Indiana , and Union University in Jackson , Tennessee .
#Text=He holds a bachelor 's degree in Psychology and Communication . [ 1 ]
#Text=While leading music and coaching high school soccer teams he began writing songs .

#Text=What began as weekend and summer work with youth and college students soon turned into a full-time career during his twenties and thirties , and prompted Rice to write and perform mainly on the guitar .
#Text=For those two decades , Rice spent his time as an itinerant speaker and songwriter/musician , playing for high school and college conferences and camps nationwide .
#Text=This schedule prepared Chris for his career as a signed recording artist , touring the country with a full band .
#Text=Career as a songwriter
#Text=Rice 's songwriting career began in the mid-1980s , after moving from his Washington , D.C. , home to Nashville , Tenn.
#Text=During that period several of Rice 's songs were recorded by other artists , including Kathy Troccoli and Terri Gibbs .

#Text=Rice 's " Welcome to Our World " , an original Christmas song since recorded by Michael W. Smith , Amy Grant and John Tesh , moved Smith to urge his new label , Rocketown Records , to sign Rice as its first artist in 1996 .
#Text=Solo artist
#Text=With the help of Monroe Jones ' production skills , Chris Rice recorded Deep Enough to Dream for a September 1997 release .
#Text=Past the Edges followed a year later .
#Text=Rice 's third album , Smell the Color 9 , was issued in late 2000 .
#Text=In 2001 , Rice released two piano -only , instrumental releases , The Living Room Sessions and The Living Room Sessions : Christmas , recorded on Rice 's own living room grand piano .
#Text=His sixth album , Run the Earth ... Watch the Sky , released in March 2003 , Chris again joined the production talents of his longtime friend and collaborator Monroe Jones .
#Text=The album 's first single was " The Other Side of the Radio " .

#Text=These four studio releases ( plus the two instrumental releases ) fulfilled Rice 's contractual commitment to Rocketown and they issued several compilation albums , Short Term Memories and Snapshots : Live and Fan Favorites , following his departure in June 2004 and February 2005 respectively .
#Text=New record label

#Text=Rice signed with independent label Eb+Flo Records , and made a marketing and distribution agreement with INO Records who had distribution through Sony/Columbia removed the limitation of catering his music to Christian radio formats .
#Text=His fifth studio album , Amusing , released in August 2005 .

#Text=For the first time in his career , Rice released radio singles to AC and Light Rock stations around the country , the first single being a light romantic song entitled " When Did You Fall ( In Love With Me ? ) " which reached No.8 on the Pop AC radio format and enjoyed Top Ten status throughout the middle of 2006 .
#Text=A second AC hit , " Lemonade " , began climbing the AC chart in 2007 .
#Text=With his success on the AC radio format , Rice released a side project hearkening back to his roots , a vocal hymns album , Peace Like a River : The Hymns Project , in November 2006 .
#Text=Rice released What a Heart Is Beating For in July 2007 , further positioning him as a pop artist .
#Text=Only 2 of its 13 songs contained overt faith themes .
#Text=Other
#Text=Since 2007 , Rice has branched out in the visual arts , including photography and painting . [ 2 ] In 2016 , he self-published Widen , a book of poetry . [ 3 ] [ 4 ]
#Text=In December 2018 , Rice and Andrew Ripp pre-released an album , Songs We Wrote on Tuesdays , as Ripp+Rice as well as a single " This Ai n't No Love Song " from that album . [ 5 ]
#Text=The album , a mix of adult contemporary and country music and was officially released on January 4 , 2019 . [ 6 ]
#Text=Discography
#Text=Studio albums
#Text=EPs and other releases
#Text=Singles
#Text=Awards
#Text=1998 – Nominated for six Dove Awards , including New Artist of the Year , Male Vocalist of the Year , Songwriter of the Year and Pop/Contemporary Album of the Year [ 12 ]
#Text=1999 – Dove Award winner for Male Vocalist of the Year and for participation in Special Event Album of the Year – Exodus
#Text=2000 – Dove Award nominee for Recorded Music Packaging
#Text=2002 – Dove Award nominee for Instrumental Album of the Year – Living Room Sessions : Hymns
